Description: Ostracon, fragment of the rim of a fine buff-coloured pottery dish with flaring sides and everted ledge-rim, the whole is covered with a red-orange slip, with remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink on both the interior and the exterior.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393876) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393876)
Almásy-Martin 2020 / Demotic, Greek and Coptic ostraca from Abydos in the British Museum (no.31)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.BM Abydos Copt. 1 (Edition abbreviation according to Oates et al. 2001)
